comments:
Build ID: tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100C

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Starr the RCP log analyzer
2.Import any cbe xml log
3.Following null pointer get thrown.


More information:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.tptp.platform.common.cbe 4 0 2007-05-28 13:26:18.125
!MESSAGE An error occurred while attempting to import the log file D:\logs\perf\XML20K.xml.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.LogParserException: IWAT0412E Errors occurred parsing the log file D:\logs\perf\XML20K.xml.
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.importer.ParserWrapper.parse(ParserWrapper.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.internal.importer.LocalLogImportLoader.startParsing(LocalLogImportLoader.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.log.internal.core.LocalImportHandler.importLog(LocalImportHandler.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.logui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard$LocalLogImportJob.run(ImportLogWizard.java:994)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.tptp.platform.common.cbe 4 0 2007-05-28 13:26:18.125
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
This is been tested in large log mode.
Praful, Can you please try to use the same set-up and import small log, without large log mode and update me with the test results?

Praful,
Can you attach the hgla.log generated for when this problem was encountered? The hgla.log would have more information related to the problem.
This works in xmi (In memory) mode.
What is hgla.log? Where can I find this log?
The hgla.log is generated by the GLA when it finds some problems. I think it would be generated in the temp location on your (machine on which the test was conducted) system.
Sorry, I can't find this hgla.log anymore. But at the same time run this test case and you should be able to get info what you looking for.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 157905 ***
